block.p: PFIZER INC., New York, the nation's No. 4 drug maker, said it would buy back as much as $5 billion of its common shares.
JONES APPAREL GROUP INC., New York, a maker of women's apparel, said it planned to buy back as much as $100 million of its common stock, or about 4.1 percent of its stock outstanding.

INTOWN SUITES INC., Atlanta, a developer of budget-priced, extended-stay residences, said an affiliate of Lazard Freres Real Estate Investors L.L.C. had agreed to invest $150 million in return for a preferred equity stake.

IDEXX LABORATORIES, Westbrook, Me., a maker of diagnostic and detection systems, agreed to acquire Blue Ridge Pharmaceuticals of Greensboro, N.C., an animal health pharmaceutical company, for $50 million.
